Section: Section 1 Size ~500: Blueplate Open main menu Platform About Pricing Support Log in Blueplate Provisio version 1.11.0 Last updated 9/15/2023 Support Contact Information: 805.800.8050 support@blueplate.ai This terms of service goes over the terms of a relationship between the restaurant, Blueplate Holdings LLC (the provider) and you, the consumer. Privacy We collect consumer information, including but not limited to: Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full name, and address. By making a purchase and inputting your information, you agree to us collecting, storing, and using your data in the following ways. 1: The restaurant may contact you regarding food items or order conditions, for example, to tell you a food item is unavailable, to adjust the fulfillment time, etc. 2: The restaurant and its employees will be able to see your basic information to make reference to your order, or to get in contact with you in case of any changes, or to provide you with order updates. Employees and owners are not allowed to contact customers for any other purposes than what is within reason to provide order updates. If you suspect abuse, please email support@blueplate.ai immediately. 3: You may be contacted by the Online Ordering Provider (Blueplate) to ask for your feedback regarding the online ordering system 4: You will be sent, by our automatic system, an order confirmation email if your order went through, and an emailed receipt by one of our payments partners. Your email may be stored by Sendgrid, a Twilio Product, but you will not be solicited offers by them, or receive marketing emails from them unless you sign up for the appropriate service. 5: You may receive an automatic feedback email from Blueplate. 6. You may receive general marketing communications from Blueplate, with an option to “opt out” or “unsubscribe” 7. Your data may be used in the aggregate to make informed decisions regarding overall consumer spending habits or site visit habits. 8. You may receive a confirmation text/pickup ready SMS text message. 9. We may use your data to market to you or people similar to you on our internal system. Your information is never revealed to the person being marketed to, to the public, or to third parties. For example, our system may determine that because of your spending habits, people like you may want to buy the same thing – we’d then recommend that person buys something because of the way you spent. We do not share your information with them. We may also market back to you based on your own spending habits. 10. We may use your data in the aggregate to make actionable insights in real time to other restaurants and their employees. For example, our system may use your spending habits to attempt to predict popular times and rush times, sharing this information with restaurant employees to prepare appropriately for when they might get busy. 11.We may use data about you to link actions across the platform and attribute them to you, for example if you use the same card or the same email address on two different platform actions, we’ll link them to your customer profile 12. We may collect data about your visit and site habits, such as what you click on, how you interact with the site, how long you visit for, and more. We may collect your IP address and other information regarding your internet connection, mostly for security purposes. Cookies and Device Storage We collect cookies, but not the kind you eat, as well as store information on your device. Everything Blueplate does related to cookies and device storage are for your convenience only, and shouldn’t affect your use of the service as a whole. We use cookies exclusively for authentication purposes. By storing cookies, we are able to securely, magically log you back in without you having to type in your username and password each and every time. By disabling cookies, you will not be able to persist your login, although the rest of the service should function fine. If you clear your cookies, you’ll lose any saved login details you may have had. We store information on your device specifically related to your visit and your site data. Most commonly, we’ll save your carts and abandoned carts so that just in case something happens, you don’t lose your order progress. If you disable local and session storage on your machine, the service will function fine, but your carts will be cleared on each visit, or if something out of the ordinary happens, such as a page crash, you’ll lose your progress. Cards and PCI As a facilitator of card transactions, we take card privacy, PCI compliance, and general security very seriously. Although our legal agreements with our processing partners (and general security concerns) prevent us from going fully into detail about what measures we take, we can say this: Card data is sent directly to our payment partners, and is never stored on our servers. Saved cards are stored managed by these partners. We follow and abide by ALL PCI regulations and standards. We accept the 4 major American Card brands: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We apply a 5.99% Convenience Fee to offset the restaurants cost of cards and help pay for the service. This fee is applied in compliance with convenience fee programs set by the card brands. Fulfillment Policy Orders that are recieved are prepared for the designated time provided. Please come to the pickup window and state your name. The associate may ask you to provide additional information for verification purposes. If your order is recieved but not ready, the restaurant will do their best in good faith to notify you when it will be ready. Enjoy! Occasionally, for reasons that are beyond our control, orders that are confirmed are not received. Power outages, network interruptions, severe weather, etc, may impact a restaurants ability to receive online orders.

User: This taxonomy serves as your reference for understanding and classifying various privacy practices mentioned in the policies.
Privacy Behavior Taxonomy:
Category: Actions
 - sub: Subcategories: Consent, Delete, stop, anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Collect: Synonyms: Store, Keep, Retain, Provide Us, save; Subcategories: external, Internal, Third-Party, Automatic; 
 - Process: Synonyms: Use; Subcategories: Inference, Reference; 
 - Share: Synonyms: Transfer, Disclose, Disclosure, Use Third Party; Subcategories: Internal; 
Category: Data Types
 - sub: Subcategories: anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Personal Data: Synonyms: Personally Identifiable Information, PII, Personal Information, Your Data, Your Information; Subcategories: Contact Data, Health Data, Social Media, Location, Financial, Usage Data, Tracking, Account Information; 
Category: Purpose
 - Contact: Synonyms: Support, Messaged; Subcategories: Receive, Send, Communicate; 
 - Analytics: Synonyms: analyze; Subcategories: Data Analysis, User Similarity, Statistical Analysis, User Habits, Internal Analysis, Marketing Effectiveness, System Analysis; 
 - Customization: Synonyms: personalization; Subcategories: Customer Profile, Manage Account, Memorization; 
 - Advertisement: Synonyms: marketing, advertising; Subcategories: Tailored Ads, Targeted Ads; 
 - Security: Subcategories: System Protection, User Protection; 
 - Tracking: Subcategories: Site Visits Internal, Site Visits External; 
 - Functionality: Synonyms: Provide, Optimize, Enable, Operate, Maintain, Better Service; Subcategories: Business Purpose, Commercial Purpose, Access, Accounts, Payments, Provide Service, Data Storage, Account Management, Provide Support, Order Fulfillment, Support, Promotions; 
 - Requirements: Synonyms: Compliance; Subcategories: legal compliance, Policy Compliance, Third-Party Compliance, Business Compliance; 
 - Save: Subcategories: Store, Order Progress; 
 - Identification: Synonyms: Identify, authenticate; Subcategories: Verified Feedback;

User: Write the privacy behaviors found within this text and those which are connected reflect a critical understanding of the text. Be mindful of avoiding assumptions or hallucinations that are not supported by the text.
System: Privacy Behaviors:
### Category: Actions

- **Collect**:
  - **Subcategories**: Internal, External, Third-Party
  - **Details**: The policy specifies that Blueplate Holdings LLC collects consumer information, including Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full name, and address. Additionally, it collects data about visits and site habits, IP addresses, and other information related to the internet connection.
  
- **Process**:
  - **Subcategories**: Inference, Reference
  - **Details**: The policy outlines the use of collected data for processing orders, providing updates, asking for feedback on the online ordering system, sending automatic confirmation emails, and making informed decisions about consumer habits.

- **Share**:
  - **Subcategories**: Internal
  - **Details**: Shared with restaurant employees for fulfilling orders and providing customer support. Information is used internally for marketing to similar customers without disclosing personal information to third parties or the public.

- **Delete, stop, anonymize, aggregate**:
  - Not explicitly mentioned but implied in the use of aggregation for decisions regarding consumer spending habits or site visit habits.

### Category: Data Types

- **Personal Data**:
  - **Subcategories**: Contact Data (Phone Number, Email), Location (indirectly mentioned through address), Usage Data (Site Visit Habits, Spending Habits), Account Information (Full name, Address).
  
- **anonymize, aggregate**:
  - Mentioned in the context of using data in aggregate for making decisions on consumer habits and marketing strategies.

### Category: Purpose

- **Contact**:
  - **Details**: Customers may be contacted for food order conditions, feedback on the ordering system, order confirmation, and automatic feedback emails.

- **Analytics**:
  - **Details**: Data used for making informed decisions regarding consumer spending or site visit habits, also for actionable insights shared with other restaurants to predict busy times.

- **Customization**:
  - **Details**: Personal data is used to market to customers or similar individuals on the internal system based on spending habits.

- **Advertisement**:
  - **Details**: Includes general marketing communications with an opt-out option.

- **Security**:
  - **Details**: Collecting IP addresses and internet connection data, mostly for security purposes. Card data privacy and PCI compliance are emphasized.

- **Functionality**:
  - **Details**: Use of cookies and device storage for maintaining user session and saving carts. Ensuring the service functions correctly even with cookies or local and session storage disabled.

- **Requirements**:
  - **Details**: Fulfillment of PCI compliance and card brand convenience fee programs.

### Specific Observations

- The policy emphasizes consent through the act of making a purchase and inputting information as the basis for collecting, storing, and using data.
- It details a comprehensive use of personal information for contact, ordering, feedback, marketing, and analytical purposes without explicit mention of a method for users to request deletion of their data.
- The use of data for internal analytics and marketing is highlighted without disclosing information to third parties for these purposes.
- The policy includes security measures for card transactions and personal data protection.

 System: Privacy stories:

Response2: 1. We **collect** (action) **Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full name, and address** (data type) for the purpose of **Contact, Analytics, Customization, and Advertisement** (purpose).
2. We **collect** (action) **data about visits and site habits, IP addresses, and other internet connection information** (data type) for the purpose of **Security and Functionality** (purpose).

3. We **process** (action) **collected consumer information** (data type) to **provide order updates, solicit feedback on the online ordering system, and send automatic confirmation emails** (purpose).
4. We **share** (action) **basic customer information** (data type) internally **to fulfill orders and provide customer support** (purpose).
5. We **use data in the aggregate** (action)  **to make informed decisions regarding consumer spending habits or site visit habits** (data type) for the purpose of **Analytics** (purpose).

6. We **market** (action) **to customers or similar individuals based on their spending habits using our internal system** (data type) for the purpose of **Customization and Advertisement** (purpose), without revealing personal information to external parties.

7. We **collect and use cookies and device storage** (action) **for authentication and to save user carts and abandoned carts** (data type) for the purpose of **Functionality** (purpose), ensuring users don't lose their order progress and can maintain their session.
8. We **abide by PCI compliance and do not store card data on our servers** (action) for the purpose of **Security** (purpose), emphasizing the protection of consumer financial information.

9. We **collect data about your IP address and internet connection** (action) **mostly for security purposes** (data type) for the purpose of **Security** (purpose).

These privacy stories are structured to encapsulate the various actions, data types, and purposes for handling user information as detailed in the privacy policy provided.

Questions.Question3: How would you better write the story?

Section: Section 2 Size ~500: In this case, we’ll reconcile between all 3 parties (you, the restaurant, and Blueplate, the provider) will find the best solution to satisfy you. Our top priority is to ensure that your original intent (purchasing food items through our software) is fulfilled. If an order confirmation is given, that is our system telling us it did its job. In the case of an order being confirmed, our system has processed your order. In the case of an order confirmation going through, but the restaurant not receiving it, we typically look first at external sources such as power outages or network interruptions, such as internet service providers having a service outage. Our system does our best to ensure a reliable connection is made before confirming the order, but this isn’t (and can’t) always be the case. Some orders, as is with technology, may slip through the cracks and miss all filters and precautions put in place. We will reconcile with you and with the restaurant in this case to ensure everyone is satisfied. Delivery and Shipment Policy Blueplate does not offer delivery services – any order placed for delivery on the Blueplate network is fufilled by the restaurants own delivery drivers. Any and all delivery policies are to be deferred to that restaurant. Issues with and concerning delivery are typically deferred to the restaurant. Blueplate will attempt to fix any delivery errors in good faith, but as Blueplate does not offer delivery, we do not protect against any errors in this regard. In most cases, Blueplate is a pickup only service. Refund Policy In order to get a refund, please use the support and feedback center and get in contact diretly through those channels. We will provide a partial or full refund for a missing item, wrong item, or item that does not fall under normal standards, such as presence of hair. To cancel an order, please reach out as soon as possible. As ALL orders are made as soon as they are recieved, we may not be able to cancel all orders, but we will do our best in good faith to make things right. Footer Solutions Online Ordering Payment Processing Web Hosting Support Pricing Guides Status Roadmap Company About Partners

 System: Privacy stories:

Response2: 1. We **process** "Account Information" and "Contact Data" (inferred data types) for the purpose of **Functionality** to ensure the successful completion of food orders through our software. This includes the processing necessary to confirm orders and to investigate the reasons behind any orders not being received by the restaurant, such as examining external factors like power outages or internet service disruptions.

2. We **share** "Usage Data" and possibly "Contact Data" (inferred data types) internally for the purpose of **Analytics** to resolve conflicts and ensure customer satisfaction when issues with order confirmation or delivery arise. This sharing is crucial for identifying the cause of the issue (e.g., power outages, network interruptions) and determining the appropriate course of action to fulfill the customer's original intent.

3. We **collect** "Contact Data" (inferred data type) indirectly through the operation of a support and feedback center for the purpose of **Contact**. This allows us to offer a direct channel for customers seeking refunds or needing to cancel an order, ensuring they can quickly get in touch with us to address their concerns.

4. We **collect** and **process** data related to delivery errors (the type of data can be inferred to include "Contact Data" and specific order details, which fall under "Account Information") for the purpose of **Functionality**. Though not directly offering delivery services, we engage in good faith to fix any issues arising in the process to ensure the customer's experience aligns with their expectations of our pickup service.

5. We **use** "Account Information" and potentially "Usage Data" (as it concerns the interaction with the online ordering and feedback systems) for the purpose of **Identification**. This could be necessary for authenticating requests for canceling orders or seeking refunds and for verifying feedback to maintain the integrity and reliability of these processes.

These privacy stories are generated based on the implied privacy-related activities within the given policy extract. They aim to capture the essence of the actions taken with user data for specific purposes, adhering to the privacy behavior taxonomy to the extent possible given the information provided.

Section: Section 1 Size ~500: Blueplate Open main menu Platform About Pricing Support Log in Blueplate Provisio version 1.11.0 Last updated 9/15/2023 Support Contact Information: 805.800.8050 support@blueplate.ai This terms of service goes over the terms of a relationship between the restaurant, Blueplate Holdings LLC (the provider) and you, the consumer. Privacy We collect consumer information, including but not limited to: Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full name, and address. By making a purchase and inputting your information, you agree to us collecting, storing, and using your data in the following ways. 1: The restaurant may contact you regarding food items or order conditions, for example, to tell you a food item is unavailable, to adjust the fulfillment time, etc. 2: The restaurant and its employees will be able to see your basic information to make reference to your order, or to get in contact with you in case of any changes, or to provide you with order updates. Employees and owners are not allowed to contact customers for any other purposes than what is within reason to provide order updates. If you suspect abuse, please email support@blueplate.ai immediately. 3: You may be contacted by the Online Ordering Provider (Blueplate) to ask for your feedback regarding the online ordering system 4: You will be sent, by our automatic system, an order confirmation email if your order went through, and an emailed receipt by one of our payments partners. Your email may be stored by Sendgrid, a Twilio Product, but you will not be solicited offers by them, or receive marketing emails from them unless you sign up for the appropriate service. 5: You may receive an automatic feedback email from Blueplate. 6. You may receive general marketing communications from Blueplate, with an option to “opt out” or “unsubscribe” 7. Your data may be used in the aggregate to make informed decisions regarding overall consumer spending habits or site visit habits. 8. You may receive a confirmation text/pickup ready SMS text message. 9. We may use your data to market to you or people similar to you on our internal system. Your information is never revealed to the person being marketed to, to the public, or to third parties. For example, our system may determine that because of your spending habits, people like you may want to buy the same thing – we’d then recommend that person buys something because of the way you spent. We do not share your information with them. We may also market back to you based on your own spending habits. 10. We may use your data in the aggregate to make actionable insights in real time to other restaurants and their employees. For example, our system may use your spending habits to attempt to predict popular times and rush times, sharing this information with restaurant employees to prepare appropriately for when they might get busy.

Questions.Question3: How would you better write the story?

Section: Section 2 Size ~500: 11.We may use data about you to link actions across the platform and attribute them to you, for example if you use the same card or the same email address on two different platform actions, we’ll link them to your customer profile 12. We may collect data about your visit and site habits, such as what you click on, how you interact with the site, how long you visit for, and more. We may collect your IP address and other information regarding your internet connection, mostly for security purposes. Cookies and Device Storage We collect cookies, but not the kind you eat, as well as store information on your device. Everything Blueplate does related to cookies and device storage are for your convenience only, and shouldn’t affect your use of the service as a whole. We use cookies exclusively for authentication purposes. By storing cookies, we are able to securely, magically log you back in without you having to type in your username and password each and every time. By disabling cookies, you will not be able to persist your login, although the rest of the service should function fine. If you clear your cookies, you’ll lose any saved login details you may have had. We store information on your device specifically related to your visit and your site data. Most commonly, we’ll save your carts and abandoned carts so that just in case something happens, you don’t lose your order progress. If you disable local and session storage on your machine, the service will function fine, but your carts will be cleared on each visit, or if something out of the ordinary happens, such as a page crash, you’ll lose your progress. Cards and PCI As a facilitator of card transactions, we take card privacy, PCI compliance, and general security very seriously. Although our legal agreements with our processing partners (and general security concerns) prevent us from going fully into detail about what measures we take, we can say this: Card data is sent directly to our payment partners, and is never stored on our servers. Saved cards are stored managed by these partners. We follow and abide by ALL PCI regulations and standards. We accept the 4 major American Card brands: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We apply a 5.99% Convenience Fee to offset the restaurants cost of cards and help pay for the service. This fee is applied in compliance with convenience fee programs set by the card brands. Fulfillment Policy Orders that are recieved are prepared for the designated time provided. Please come to the pickup window and state your name. The associate may ask you to provide additional information for verification purposes. If your order is recieved but not ready, the restaurant will do their best in good faith to notify you when it will be ready. Enjoy! Occasionally, for reasons that are beyond our control, orders that are confirmed are not received.

Questions.Question3: How would you better write the story?

Section: Section 3 Size ~500: Power outages, network interruptions, severe weather, etc, may impact a restaurants ability to receive online orders. In this case, we’ll reconcile between all 3 parties (you, the restaurant, and Blueplate, the provider) will find the best solution to satisfy you. Our top priority is to ensure that your original intent (purchasing food items through our software) is fulfilled. If an order confirmation is given, that is our system telling us it did its job. In the case of an order being confirmed, our system has processed your order. In the case of an order confirmation going through, but the restaurant not receiving it, we typically look first at external sources such as power outages or network interruptions, such as internet service providers having a service outage. Our system does our best to ensure a reliable connection is made before confirming the order, but this isn’t (and can’t) always be the case. Some orders, as is with technology, may slip through the cracks and miss all filters and precautions put in place. We will reconcile with you and with the restaurant in this case to ensure everyone is satisfied. Delivery and Shipment Policy Blueplate does not offer delivery services – any order placed for delivery on the Blueplate network is fufilled by the restaurants own delivery drivers. Any and all delivery policies are to be deferred to that restaurant. Issues with and concerning delivery are typically deferred to the restaurant. Blueplate will attempt to fix any delivery errors in good faith, but as Blueplate does not offer delivery, we do not protect against any errors in this regard. In most cases, Blueplate is a pickup only service. Refund Policy In order to get a refund, please use the support and feedback center and get in contact diretly through those channels. We will provide a partial or full refund for a missing item, wrong item, or item that does not fall under normal standards, such as presence of hair. To cancel an order, please reach out as soon as possible. As ALL orders are made as soon as they are recieved, we may not be able to cancel all orders, but we will do our best in good faith to make things right. User: As an annotator of privacy policies, your task involves identifying and categorizing privacy-related behaviors in policy texts. Each behavior should be annotated with the most specific label possible, based on the provided privacy behavior taxonomy. User: This taxonomy serves as your reference for understanding and classifying various privacy practices mentioned in the policies.
Privacy Behavior Taxonomy:
Category: Actions
 - sub: Subcategories: Consent, Delete, stop, anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Collect: Synonyms: Store, Keep, Retain, Provide Us, save; Subcategories: external, Internal, Third-Party, Automatic; 
 - Process: Synonyms: Use; Subcategories: Inference, Reference; 
 - Share: Synonyms: Transfer, Disclose, Disclosure, Use Third Party; Subcategories: Internal; 
Category: Data Types
 - sub: Subcategories: anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Personal Data: Synonyms: Personally Identifiable Information, PII, Personal Information, Your Data, Your Information; Subcategories: Contact Data, Health Data, Social Media, Location, Financial, Usage Data, Tracking, Account Information; 
Category: Purpose
 - Contact: Synonyms: Support, Messaged; Subcategories: Receive, Send, Communicate; 
 - Analytics: Synonyms: analyze; Subcategories: Data Analysis, User Similarity, Statistical Analysis, User Habits, Internal Analysis, Marketing Effectiveness, System Analysis; 
 - Customization: Synonyms: personalization; Subcategories: Customer Profile, Manage Account, Memorization; 
 - Advertisement: Synonyms: marketing, advertising; Subcategories: Tailored Ads, Targeted Ads; 
 - Security: Subcategories: System Protection, User Protection; 
 - Tracking: Subcategories: Site Visits Internal, Site Visits External; 
 - Functionality: Synonyms: Provide, Optimize, Enable, Operate, Maintain, Better Service; Subcategories: Business Purpose, Commercial Purpose, Access, Accounts, Payments, Provide Service, Data Storage, Account Management, Provide Support, Order Fulfillment, Support, Promotions; 
 - Requirements: Synonyms: Compliance; Subcategories: legal compliance, Policy Compliance, Third-Party Compliance, Business Compliance; 
 - Save: Subcategories: Store, Order Progress; 
 - Identification: Synonyms: Identify, authenticate; Subcategories: Verified Feedback;

Privacy Policy October 29, 2021 ‍ Owner.com, Inc. (“ Owner ,” “ we ,” “ our ,” and/or “ us ”) values the privacy of individuals who use our websites (including
https://www.Owner.com/ ) and any of our other websites, applications, or services that link to this Privacy Policy (collectively, our “ Services ”).  This privacy policy (the “ Privacy Policy ”) explains how we  collect,  use, and  disclose  personal information from users of our Services. By using our Services, you agree to the  collection,  use, and  disclosure of your  personal information as described in this Privacy Policy.  Beyond this Privacy Policy, your use of our Services is also subject to our Terms of Service. ‍ Information We Collect  We may  collect a variety of  personal information from or about you or your devices from various sources, as described below. ‍ A. Information You Provide to Us (order fulfillment) Placing an Order. We  collect the  personal information you provide to us when you use our Services. For example, when you place an order with a restaurant through our Services, we will  collect your  personal information, including your  name,  phone number,  email address,  address,  date of birth,  Payment Information (as defined below), and any other information you provide, including details of your order and delivery instructions. If you are a member of a restaurant’s loyalty program, we will collect the personal information you provide to us in connection with your membership.    If you leave feedback for the restaurant or driver, we will collect the personal information you include in your feedback. ‍ Merchants.  If you are a merchant, or an employee of a merchant, we will  collect your  personal information in connection with your application to and use of the Services. For example, when you use or (accounts) sign up for our Services, we will  collect your  name,  email address,  mailing address,  phone number, restaurant name and  contact information, etc.. In addition to your contact information, we will collect your  tax identification number,  national identification number (e.g.,  Social Security number), and your  banking and  payment card information.  Drivers.  If you (access) sign up to use our Services as a driver, we will  collect your  personal information, including your  name,  email address,  phone number.   When you (access) use our Services to pick up and deliver an order, we will  collect your insert  personal information. ‍  Making a Payment. When you (order fulfillment) place an order with a restaurant through our Services, your  credit card information,  billing information, and any other  financial information necessary to complete your purchase (“  Payment Information ”) is (share) processed by our third-party payment processor, and we do not collect, store, or process your Payment Information.  For more information, please see the “Payment Processing” section below. ‍ Communications .  If you  contact us directly, we may receive additional personal information about you. For example if you represent a restaurant and contact us for a demo, we will receive your  name,  phone number, and email address. If you subscribe to our marketing communications, we will receive your name,  email address,  phone number, and  order history. ‍  Careers . (access) If you apply for a job with us, you may submit your  contact information and your  resume online. We will collect your  contact information and the  personal information you choose to provide on your resume, such as your  education and  employment experience.   You may also apply through certain third-party websites. If you do so, we will collect the personal information you make available to us through those websites in connection with your job application. ‍ B. Information We Collect When You Use Our Services Device Information .  We  receive information about the device and software you use to access our Services, including  internet protocol (IP) address, web  browser type, and  operating system version.  ‍  Usage Information. (analytics) To help us understand how you use our Services and to help us improve them, we automatically  receive information about your interactions with them, such as the (timestamps) length of time you spend on a page, (clicks) objects such as hyperlinks you click on, any point at which you terminate an order, and the (timestamps) dates and times of your visits. ‍ {#s  Location Information
When you use our Services, if you allow us, we will  receive your  precise location information. We may also  collect the  precise location of your device when our Services are running in the foreground or background. We  use your  location information to (localization) insert a description of how you use location information. We may also infer your general location information, for example by using your  internet protocol (IP) address./} {#s Information from  Cookies and Similar Technologies. We and our third-party partners may  collect information using  cookies,  pixel tags, or similar technologies. (share) Our third-party partners, such as  analytics and  advertising partners, may use these technologies to collect information about your online activities over time and across different services. User: Privacy Policy:
Blueplate Open main menu Platform About Pricing Support Log in Blueplate Provisio version 1.11.0 Last updated 9/15/2023 Support Contact Information: 805.800.8050 support@blueplate.ai This terms of service goes over the terms of a relationship between the restaurant, Blueplate Holdings LLC (the provider) and you, the consumer. Privacy We collect consumer information, including but not limited to: Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full name, and address. By making a purchase and inputting your information, you agree to us collecting, storing, and using your data in the following ways. 1: The restaurant may contact you regarding food items or order conditions, for example, to tell you a food item is unavailable, to adjust the fulfillment time, etc. 2: The restaurant and its employees will be able to see your basic information to make reference to your order, or to get in contact with you in case of any changes, or to provide you with order updates. Employees and owners are not allowed to contact customers for any other purposes than what is within reason to provide order updates. If you suspect abuse, please email support@blueplate.ai immediately. 3: You may be contacted by the Online Ordering Provider (Blueplate) to ask for your feedback regarding the online ordering system 4: You will be sent, by our automatic system, an order confirmation email if your order went through, and an emailed receipt by one of our payments partners. Your email may be stored by Sendgrid, a Twilio Product, but you will not be solicited offers by them, or receive marketing emails from them unless you sign up for the appropriate service. 5: You may receive an automatic feedback email from Blueplate. 6. You may receive general marketing communications from Blueplate, with an option to “opt out” or “unsubscribe” 7. Your data may be used in the aggregate to make informed decisions regarding overall consumer spending habits or site visit habits. 8. You may receive a confirmation text/pickup ready SMS text message. 9. We may use your data to market to you or people similar to you on our internal system. Your information is never revealed to the person being marketed to, to the public, or to third parties. For example, our system may determine that because of your spending habits, people like you may want to buy the same thing – we’d then recommend that person buys something because of the way you spent. We do not share your information with them. We may also market back to you based on your own spending habits. 10. We may use your data in the aggregate to make actionable insights in real time to other restaurants and their employees. For example, our system may use your spending habits to attempt to predict popular times and rush times, sharing this information with restaurant employees to prepare appropriately for when they might get busy. 11.We may use data about you to link actions across the platform and attribute them to you, for example if you use the same card or the same email address on two different platform actions, we’ll link them to your customer profile 12. We may collect data about your visit and site habits, such as what you click on, how you interact with the site, how long you visit for, and more. We may collect your IP address and other information regarding your internet connection, mostly for security purposes. Cookies and Device Storage We collect cookies, but not the kind you eat, as well as store information on your device. Everything Blueplate does related to cookies and device storage are for your convenience only, and shouldn’t affect your use of the service as a whole. We use cookies exclusively for authentication purposes. By storing cookies, we are able to securely, magically log you back in without you having to type in your username and password each and every time. By disabling cookies, you will not be able to persist your login, although the rest of the service should function fine. If you clear your cookies, you’ll lose any saved login details you may have had. We store information on your device specifically related to your visit and your site data. Most commonly, we’ll save your carts and abandoned carts so that just in case something happens, you don’t lose your order progress. If you disable local and session storage on your machine, the service will function fine, but your carts will be cleared on each visit, or if something out of the ordinary happens, such as a page crash, you’ll lose your progress. Cards and PCI As a facilitator of card transactions, we take card privacy, PCI compliance, and general security very seriously. Although our legal agreements with our processing partners (and general security concerns) prevent us from going fully into detail about what measures we take, we can say this: Card data is sent directly to our payment partners, and is never stored on our servers. Saved cards are stored managed by these partners. We follow and abide by ALL PCI regulations and standards. We accept the 4 major American Card brands: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We apply a 5.99% Convenience Fee to offset the restaurants cost of cards and help pay for the service. This fee is applied in compliance with convenience fee programs set by the card brands. Fulfillment Policy Orders that are recieved are prepared for the designated time provided. Please come to the pickup window and state your name. The associate may ask you to provide additional information for verification purposes. If your order is recieved but not ready, the restaurant will do their best in good faith to notify you when it will be ready. Enjoy! Occasionally, for reasons that are beyond our control, orders that are confirmed are not received. Power outages, network interruptions, severe weather, etc, may impact a restaurants ability to receive online orders.

System: Privacy Behaviors:
Based on the provided text, the privacy behaviors can be categorized according to the Privacy Behavior Taxonomy as follows:

1. **Actions**
   - **Collect**
     - Personal information including but not limited to: Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full name, address, data about visit and site habits, IP address, and other internet connection information.
   - **Use**
     - Your data for contacting regarding food items or order conditions, order updates, feedback solicitation, automatic order confirmation and receipt emails, general marketing communications, making informed decisions regarding consumer spending or site visit habits, marketing to you or others based on spending habits, actionable insights for restaurants, linking actions across the platform to your profile.
   - **Share**
     - Credit card data is sent directly to payment partners and is not stored on the service's servers.

2. **Data Types**
   - **Personal Data**
     - Contact Data: Phone Number, Email Address, Full Name, Address.
     - Financial Data: Credit Card Information.
     - Usage Data: Spending Habits, Site Visit Habits, Interaction with the Site.
     - Tracking: Cookies and Device Storage information, IP Address (mostly for security purposes).

3. **Purpose**
   - **Contact**
     - To inform about order conditions, unavailable food items, adjustments in fulfillment time, and provide other order updates. Also, to solicit feedback about the online ordering system.
   - **Analytics**
     - To gain insights from data about consumer spending habits and site visit habits, predict popular times for restaurants, and make real-time actionable insights.
   - **Customization**
     - To provide a personalized marketing experience based on the analysis of spending habits.
   - **Advertisement**
     - To send general marketing communications and recommendations based on analyzed spending habits.
   - **Security**
     - Collecting data about IP address and internet connection for security purposes.
   - **Tracking**
     - Through the use of cookies and device storage for authentication and storing information about the user's visit and site data.
   - **Functionality**
     - Using cookies for authentication purposes, enabling easy login for users. Saving carts and progress on the site for user convenience.
   - **Requirement**
     - Compliance with PCI regulations and standards for handling credit card transactions.

By itemizing the behaviors in the context of the taxonomy, this analysis ensures clarity and precision in identifying specific privacy-related practices disclosed in the privacy policy of Blueplate.

Questions.Question3: How would you better write the story?

Section: Section 2 Size ~1000: In this case, we’ll reconcile between all 3 parties (you, the restaurant, and Blueplate, the provider) will find the best solution to satisfy you. Our top priority is to ensure that your original intent (purchasing food items through our software) is fulfilled. If an order confirmation is given, that is our system telling us it did its job. In the case of an order being confirmed, our system has processed your order. In the case of an order confirmation going through, but the restaurant not receiving it, we typically look first at external sources such as power outages or network interruptions, such as internet service providers having a service outage. Our system does our best to ensure a reliable connection is made before confirming the order, but this isn’t (and can’t) always be the case. Some orders, as is with technology, may slip through the cracks and miss all filters and precautions put in place. We will reconcile with you and with the restaurant in this case to ensure everyone is satisfied. Delivery and Shipment Policy Blueplate does not offer delivery services – any order placed for delivery on the Blueplate network is fufilled by the restaurants own delivery drivers. Any and all delivery policies are to be deferred to that restaurant. Issues with and concerning delivery are typically deferred to the restaurant. Blueplate will attempt to fix any delivery errors in good faith, but as Blueplate does not offer delivery, we do not protect against any errors in this regard. In most cases, Blueplate is a pickup only service. Refund Policy In order to get a refund, please use the support and feedback center and get in contact diretly through those channels. We will provide a partial or full refund for a missing item, wrong item, or item that does not fall under normal standards, such as presence of hair. To cancel an order, please reach out as soon as possible. As ALL orders are made as soon as they are recieved, we may not be able to cancel all orders, but we will do our best in good faith to make things right. User: This taxonomy serves as your reference for understanding and classifying various privacy practices mentioned in the policies.
Privacy Behavior Taxonomy:
Category: Actions
 - sub: Subcategories: Consent, Delete, stop, anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Collect: Synonyms: Store, Keep, Retain, Provide Us, save; Subcategories: external, Internal, Third-Party, Automatic; 
 - Process: Synonyms: Use; Subcategories: Inference, Reference; 
 - Share: Synonyms: Transfer, Disclose, Disclosure, Use Third Party; Subcategories: Internal; 
Category: Data Types
 - sub: Subcategories: anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Personal Data: Synonyms: Personally Identifiable Information, PII, Personal Information, Your Data, Your Information; Subcategories: Contact Data, Health Data, Social Media, Location, Financial, Usage Data, Tracking, Account Information; 
Category: Purpose
 - Contact: Synonyms: Support, Messaged; Subcategories: Receive, Send, Communicate; 
 - Analytics: Synonyms: analyze; Subcategories: Data Analysis, User Similarity, Statistical Analysis, User Habits, Internal Analysis, Marketing Effectiveness, System Analysis; 
 - Customization: Synonyms: personalization; Subcategories: Customer Profile, Manage Account, Memorization; 
 - Advertisement: Synonyms: marketing, advertising; Subcategories: Tailored Ads, Targeted Ads; 
 - Security: Subcategories: System Protection, User Protection; 
 - Tracking: Subcategories: Site Visits Internal, Site Visits External; 
 - Functionality: Synonyms: Provide, Optimize, Enable, Operate, Maintain, Better Service; Subcategories: Business Purpose, Commercial Purpose, Access, Accounts, Payments, Provide Service, Data Storage, Account Management, Provide Support, Order Fulfillment, Support, Promotions; 
 - Requirements: Synonyms: Compliance; Subcategories: legal compliance, Policy Compliance, Third-Party Compliance, Business Compliance; 
 - Save: Subcategories: Store, Order Progress; 
 - Identification: Synonyms: Identify, authenticate; Subcategories: Verified Feedback; 

User: Privacy policy: 9.2 No warranty is provided for the Licensed Application that is not executable on the device, that has been unauthorizedly modified, handled inappropriately or culpably, combined or installed with inappropriate hardware or software, used with inappropriate accessories, regardless if by Yourself or by third parties, or if there are any other reasons outside of our sphere of influence that affect the executability of the Licensed Application. 9.3 If we confirm that the Licensed Application is defective, we reserve a choice to remedy the situation either by means of solving the defect or substitute delivery. 9.4 In the event of any failure of the Licensed Application to conform to any applicable warranty, You may notify the Services Store Operator, and Your Licensed Application purchase price will be refunded to You. To the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, the Services Store Operator will have no other warranty obligation whatsoever with respect to the Licensed Application, and any other losses, claims, damages, liabilities, expenses, and costs attributable to any negligence to adhere to any warranty. 9.5 If the user is an entrepreneur, any claim based on faults expires after a statutory period of limitation amounting to twelve (12) months after the Licensed Application was made available to the user. The statutory periods of limitation given by law apply for users who are consumers. 10. LEGAL COMPLIANCE You represent and warrant that You are not located in a country that is subject to a US Government embargo, or that has been designated by the US Government as a "terrorist supporting" country; and that You are not listed on any US Government list of prohibited or restricted parties. 11. TERMINATION The license is valid until terminated by Us or by You. Your rights under this license will terminate automatically and without notice from us. if You fail to adhere to any term(s) of this license. Upon License termination, You shall stop all use of the Licensed Application, and destroy all copies, full or partial, of the Licensed Application. 12. THIRD-PARTY TERMS OF AGREEMENTS AND BENEFICIARY We represent and warrant that we will comply with applicable third-party terms of agreement when using Licensed Application. In Accordance with Section 9 of the "Instructions for Minimum Terms of Developer's End-User License Agreement," both Apple and Google and their subsidiaries shall be third-party beneficiaries of this End User License Agreement and — upon Your acceptance of the terms and conditions of this License Agreement, both Apple and Google will have the right (and will be deemed to have accepted the right) to enforce this End User License Agreement against You as a third-party beneficiary thereof. 13. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS We and the End-User acknowledge that, in the event of any third-party claim that the Licensed Application or the End-User's possession and use of that Licensed Application infringes on the third party's intellectual property rights, we, and not the Services, will be solely responsible for the investigation, defense, settlement, and discharge or any such intellectual property infringement claims. 14.MISCELLANEOUS 14.1 If any of the terms of this agreement should be or become invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions shall not be affected. Invalid terms will be replaced by valid ones formulated in a way that will achieve the primary purpose. 14.2 Collateral agreements, changes and amendments are only valid if laid down in writing. The preceding clause can only be waived in writing. 14.3 We have no tolerance for objectionable content or abusive users. Users posting objectionable content or being abusive may be banned from the app without prior notice. 15.SUBSCRIPTION 15.1 Subscription period The Service or some parts of the Service are available only with a paid Subscription. You will be billed in advance on a recurring and periodic basis (such as daily, weekly, monthly or annually), depending on the type of Subscription plan you select when purchasing the Subscription. At the end of each period, Your Subscription will automatically renew under the exact same conditions unless You cancel it. 15.2 Subscription cancellations You may cancel Your Subscription renewal through Your App Store or Google Play Account settings page. You will not receive a refund for the fees You already paid for Your current Subscription period and You will be able to access the Service until the end of Your current Subscription period. 15.3 Billing If the Subscription has been made through an In-app Purchase, all billing is handled by the Application Store and is governed by the Application Store's own terms and conditions. 15.4 Fee Changes NCharacter.ai, in its sole discretion and at any time, may modify the Subscription fees. Any Subscription fee change will become effective at the end of the then-current Subscription period. Your continued use of the Service after the Subscription fee change comes into effect constitutes Your agreement to pay the modified Subscription fee amount. 15.5 Refunds Paid Subscription fees are non-refundable. If the Subscription has been made through an In-app purchase, the Application Store refund policy will apply. If You wish to request a refund, You may do so by contacting the Application Store directly. 15.6 Free Trial NCharacter.ai may, at its sole discretion, offer a Subscription with a Free trial for a limited period of time. If your subscription includes a free trial service, on the last day of the Free Trial period, unless You cancel Your Subscription at least 24 hours before the end of the current period, You will be automatically charged the applicable Subscription fees for the type of Subscription You have selected. At any time and without notice, we reserves the right to (i) modify the terms and conditions of the Free Trial offer, or (ii) cancel such Free trial offer. 16.IN-APP PURCHASE The Application may include In-app Purchases that allow you to buy products, services or Subscriptions. More information about how you may be able to manage In-app Purchases using your Device may be set out in the Application Store's own terms and conditions or in your Device's Help settings. Based on the provided privacy behavior taxonomy and the details within the given privacy policies, here’s a breakdown of the privacy behaviors identified in the provided texts:

### Privacy Policy of Licensing Application

#### Legal Compliance
- **Behavior:** Represents and warrants compliance with third-party agreements and U.S. Government embargoes; not provided to prohibited parties.
- **Category:** Requirements (Legal compliance)

#### Termination
- **Behavior:** License termination upon violation of terms; requires cessation of use and destruction of copies.
- **Category:** Actions (Stop)

#### Third-Party Terms and Beneficiary
- **Behavior:** Compliance with third-party terms; Apple and Google as third-party beneficiaries.
- **Category:** Requirements (Third-Party Compliance)

#### Intellectual Property Rights
- **Behavior:** Sole responsibility for defense against intellectual property infringement claims.
- **Category:** Requirements (Business Compliance)

#### Subscription and Billing
- **Behavior:** Autoforward renewal unless cancellation; modifications to subscription fees; refunds align with app store policies.
- **Category:** Actions (Collect, Process) 

### Privacy Policy for Blueplate Service

#### Order Processing and Confirmation
- **Behavior:** Confirmation of orders; dealing with external issues affecting order confirmation.
- **Category:** Actions (Process)

#### Delivery and Shipment
- **Behavior:** Clarifies absence of delivery services; relies on restaurants for delivery.
- **Category:** Actions (Share) - Specifically noting that they do not directly engage in delivery but share the responsibility with third-party restaurants.

#### Refund Policy
- **Behavior:** Provides refund under specific conditions; emphasizes direct communication for refunds or cancellations.
- **Category:** Actions (Process)

### General Analysis

The privacy behaviors predominantly revolve around the processing of transactions and compliance with legal requirements and third-party terms. It's critical to highlight that there's a specific emphasis on actions (processing, collecting information such as billing details, and termination of services) and requirements (compliance with laws, policies, and third-party agreements). 

Given the nature of the descriptions provided in both policies, a significant privacy behavior concern relates to the collection and processing of data necessary for fulfilling services, handle refunds, and ensuring compliance with legal and policy standards. However, it is essential to acknowledge that these identified behaviors are based purely on the text provided and do not assume any privacy practices not explicitly mentioned.

### Privacy Policy for Blueplate Service

These privacy stories, crafted from the identified privacy behaviors, offer a comprehensive view of actions, data handling, and objectives as mentioned in the policies, ensuring alignment with the actual content and structure given in the privacy policy excerpts.

Section: Section 1 Size ~1000: Blueplate Open main menu Platform About Pricing Support Log in Blueplate Provisio version 1.11.0 Last updated 9/15/2023 Support Contact Information: 805.800.8050 support@blueplate.ai This terms of service goes over the terms of a relationship between the restaurant, Blueplate Holdings LLC (the provider) and you, the consumer. Privacy We collect consumer information, including but not limited to: Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full name, and address. By making a purchase and inputting your information, you agree to us collecting, storing, and using your data in the following ways. 1: The restaurant may contact you regarding food items or order conditions, for example, to tell you a food item is unavailable, to adjust the fulfillment time, etc. 2: The restaurant and its employees will be able to see your basic information to make reference to your order, or to get in contact with you in case of any changes, or to provide you with order updates. Employees and owners are not allowed to contact customers for any other purposes than what is within reason to provide order updates. If you suspect abuse, please email support@blueplate.ai immediately. 3: You may be contacted by the Online Ordering Provider (Blueplate) to ask for your feedback regarding the online ordering system 4: You will be sent, by our automatic system, an order confirmation email if your order went through, and an emailed receipt by one of our payments partners. Your email may be stored by Sendgrid, a Twilio Product, but you will not be solicited offers by them, or receive marketing emails from them unless you sign up for the appropriate service. 5: You may receive an automatic feedback email from Blueplate. 6. You may receive general marketing communications from Blueplate, with an option to “opt out” or “unsubscribe” 7. Your data may be used in the aggregate to make informed decisions regarding overall consumer spending habits or site visit habits. 8. You may receive a confirmation text/pickup ready SMS text message. 9. We may use your data to market to you or people similar to you on our internal system. Your information is never revealed to the person being marketed to, to the public, or to third parties. For example, our system may determine that because of your spending habits, people like you may want to buy the same thing – we’d then recommend that person buys something because of the way you spent. We do not share your information with them. We may also market back to you based on your own spending habits. 10. We may use your data in the aggregate to make actionable insights in real time to other restaurants and their employees. For example, our system may use your spending habits to attempt to predict popular times and rush times, sharing this information with restaurant employees to prepare appropriately for when they might get busy. 11.We may use data about you to link actions across the platform and attribute them to you, for example if you use the same card or the same email address on two different platform actions, we’ll link them to your customer profile 12. We may collect data about your visit and site habits, such as what you click on, how you interact with the site, how long you visit for, and more. We may collect your IP address and other information regarding your internet connection, mostly for security purposes. Cookies and Device Storage We collect cookies, but not the kind you eat, as well as store information on your device. Everything Blueplate does related to cookies and device storage are for your convenience only, and shouldn’t affect your use of the service as a whole. We use cookies exclusively for authentication purposes. By storing cookies, we are able to securely, magically log you back in without you having to type in your username and password each and every time. By disabling cookies, you will not be able to persist your login, although the rest of the service should function fine. If you clear your cookies, you’ll lose any saved login details you may have had. We store information on your device specifically related to your visit and your site data. Most commonly, we’ll save your carts and abandoned carts so that just in case something happens, you don’t lose your order progress. If you disable local and session storage on your machine, the service will function fine, but your carts will be cleared on each visit, or if something out of the ordinary happens, such as a page crash, you’ll lose your progress. Cards and PCI As a facilitator of card transactions, we take card privacy, PCI compliance, and general security very seriously. Although our legal agreements with our processing partners (and general security concerns) prevent us from going fully into detail about what measures we take, we can say this: Card data is sent directly to our payment partners, and is never stored on our servers. Saved cards are stored managed by these partners. We follow and abide by ALL PCI regulations and standards. We accept the 4 major American Card brands: Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover. We apply a 5.99% Convenience Fee to offset the restaurants cost of cards and help pay for the service. This fee is applied in compliance with convenience fee programs set by the card brands. Fulfillment Policy Orders that are recieved are prepared for the designated time provided. Please come to the pickup window and state your name. The associate may ask you to provide additional information for verification purposes. If your order is recieved but not ready, the restaurant will do their best in good faith to notify you when it will be ready. Enjoy! Occasionally, for reasons that are beyond our control, orders that are confirmed are not received. Power outages, network interruptions, severe weather, etc, may impact a restaurants ability to receive online orders.

User: As an annotator of privacy policies, your task involves identifying and categorizing privacy-related behaviors in policy texts. Each behavior should be annotated with the most specific label possible, based on the provided privacy behavior taxonomy. User: This taxonomy serves as your reference for understanding and classifying various privacy practices mentioned in the policies.
Privacy Behavior Taxonomy:
Category: Actions
 - sub: Subcategories: Consent, Delete, stop, anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Collect: Synonyms: Store, Keep, Retain, Provide Us, save; Subcategories: external, Internal, Third-Party, Automatic; 
 - Process: Synonyms: Use; Subcategories: Inference, Reference; 
 - Share: Synonyms: Transfer, Disclose, Disclosure, Use Third Party; Subcategories: Internal; 
Category: Data Types
 - sub: Subcategories: anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Personal Data: Synonyms: Personally Identifiable Information, PII, Personal Information, Your Data, Your Information; Subcategories: Contact Data, Health Data, Social Media, Location, Financial, Usage Data, Tracking, Account Information; 
Category: Purpose
 - Contact: Synonyms: Support, Messaged; Subcategories: Receive, Send, Communicate; 
 - Analytics: Synonyms: analyze; Subcategories: Data Analysis, User Similarity, Statistical Analysis, User Habits, Internal Analysis, Marketing Effectiveness, System Analysis; 
 - Customization: Synonyms: personalization; Subcategories: Customer Profile, Manage Account, Memorization; 
 - Advertisement: Synonyms: marketing, advertising; Subcategories: Tailored Ads, Targeted Ads; 
 - Security: Subcategories: System Protection, User Protection; 
 - Tracking: Subcategories: Site Visits Internal, Site Visits External; 
 - Functionality: Synonyms: Provide, Optimize, Enable, Operate, Maintain, Better Service; Subcategories: Business Purpose, Commercial Purpose, Access, Accounts, Payments, Provide Service, Data Storage, Account Management, Provide Support, Order Fulfillment, Support, Promotions; 
 - Requirements: Synonyms: Compliance; Subcategories: legal compliance, Policy Compliance, Third-Party Compliance, Business Compliance; 
 - Save: Subcategories: Store, Order Progress; 
 - Identification: Synonyms: Identify, authenticate; Subcategories: Verified Feedback;

Privacy Policy October 29, 2021 ‍ Owner.com, Inc. (“ Owner ,” “ we ,” “ our ,” and/or “ us ”) values the privacy of individuals who use our websites (including
https://www.Owner.com/ ) and any of our other websites, applications, or services that link to this Privacy Policy (collectively, our “ Services ”).  This privacy policy (the “ Privacy Policy ”) explains how we  collect,  use, and  disclose  personal information from users of our Services. By using our Services, you agree to the  collection,  use, and  disclosure of your  personal information as described in this Privacy Policy.  Beyond this Privacy Policy, your use of our Services is also subject to our Terms of Service. ‍ Information We Collect  We may  collect a variety of  personal information from or about you or your devices from various sources, as described below. ‍ A. Information You Provide to Us (order fulfillment) Placing an Order. We  collect the  personal information you provide to us when you use our Services. For example, when you place an order with a restaurant through our Services, we will  collect your  personal information, including your  name,  phone number,  email address,  address,  date of birth,  Payment Information (as defined below), and any other information you provide, including details of your order and delivery instructions. If you are a member of a restaurant’s loyalty program, we will collect the personal information you provide to us in connection with your membership.    If you leave feedback for the restaurant or driver, we will collect the personal information you include in your feedback. ‍ Merchants.  If you are a merchant, or an employee of a merchant, we will  collect your  personal information in connection with your application to and use of the Services. For example, when you use or (accounts) sign up for our Services, we will  collect your  name,  email address,  mailing address,  phone number, restaurant name and  contact information, etc.. In addition to your contact information, we will collect your  tax identification number,  national identification number (e.g.,  Social Security number), and your  banking and  payment card information.  Drivers.  If you (access) sign up to use our Services as a driver, we will  collect your  personal information, including your  name,  email address,  phone number.   When you (access) use our Services to pick up and deliver an order, we will  collect your insert  personal information. ‍  Making a Payment. When you (order fulfillment) place an order with a restaurant through our Services, your  credit card information,  billing information, and any other  financial information necessary to complete your purchase (“  Payment Information ”) is (share) processed by our third-party payment processor, and we do not collect, store, or process your Payment Information.  For more information, please see the “Payment Processing” section below. ‍ Communications .  If you  contact us directly, we may receive additional personal information about you. For example if you represent a restaurant and contact us for a demo, we will receive your  name,  phone number, and email address. If you subscribe to our marketing communications, we will receive your name,  email address,  phone number, and  order history. ‍  Careers . (access) If you apply for a job with us, you may submit your  contact information and your  resume online. We will collect your  contact information and the  personal information you choose to provide on your resume, such as your  education and  employment experience.   You may also apply through certain third-party websites. If you do so, we will collect the personal information you make available to us through those websites in connection with your job application. ‍ B. Information We Collect When You Use Our Services Device Information .  We  receive information about the device and software you use to access our Services, including  internet protocol (IP) address, web  browser type, and  operating system version.  ‍  Usage Information. (analytics) To help us understand how you use our Services and to help us improve them, we automatically  receive information about your interactions with them, such as the (timestamps) length of time you spend on a page, (clicks) objects such as hyperlinks you click on, any point at which you terminate an order, and the (timestamps) dates and times of your visits. ‍ {#s  Location Information
When you use our Services, if you allow us, we will  receive your  precise location information. We may also  collect the  precise location of your device when our Services are running in the foreground or background. We  use your  location information to (localization) insert a description of how you use location information. We may also infer your general location information, for example by using your  internet protocol (IP) address./} {#s Information from  Cookies and Similar Technologies. We and our third-party partners may  collect information using  cookies,  pixel tags, or similar technologies. (share) Our third-party partners, such as  analytics and  advertising partners, may use these technologies to collect information about your online activities over time and across different services. User: Write the privacy behaviors found within this text and those which are connected reflect a critical understanding of the text. Be mindful of avoiding assumptions or hallucinations that are not supported by the text.
System: Privacy Behaviors:
**Actions: Collect, Use, Share, Store**

1. **Collect**: The policy mentions the collection of various types of personal information, including but not limited to Phone Number, Email, Spending and Site Visit Habits, Full Name, and Address.
    - **Data Types**: Personal Data (Phone Number, Email, Full Name, Address), Usage Data (Spending Habits, Site Visit Habits)
    - **Purposes**: Customization (using spending and site visit habits for personalized marketing), Contact (for order-related communications), Analytics (to analyze consumer spending habits), Security (collecting IP addresses and internet connection information for security purposes).

2. **Use**: The policy outlines the use of collected data for several purposes, such as contacting the consumer regarding food items, order conditions, asking for feedback, marketing, and making informed decisions regarding consumer habits.
    - **Data Types**: Personal Data, Usage Data
    - **Purposes**: Contact (contacting for food items, order conditions, feedback), Advertisement (general marketing communications), Analytics (using data in aggregate for decisions), Customization (marketing to users based on spending habits).

3. **Share**: Data is not explicitly stated to be shared with third parties, except for the implications of using third-party services (e.g., Sendgrid) for order confirmation emails and receipt sending.
    - **Data Types**: Email
    - **Purposes**: Functionality (order confirmation and emailed receipts).

4. **Store (Includes Collect & Save)**: Information is stored on the user's device such as cookies for authentication and session data, including carts and abandoned carts.
    - **Data Types**: Cookies, Device Information
    - **Purposes**: Functionality (ease of login, maintaining order progress).

**Category: Actions - Subcategories**

- **Consent**: By making a purchase and inputting information, consumers agree to the collection, storage, and use of their data.
    - **Purposes**: Contact, Advertisement, Analytics, Customization

- **Delete, Stop, Anonymize, Aggregate**: Mentioned in the context of using data in the aggregate, no explicit mention of deletion or anonymizing processes.

**Category: Data Types - Subcategories**

- **Anonymize, Aggregate**: Data may be used in the aggregate for analytics, though not explicitly stated to be anonymized.

**Category: Purpose - Subcategories**

- **Contact**: Consumers can be contacted for order-related reasons, feedback, and to receive automatic feedback emails.
- **Analytics**: Consumer data may be analyzed for spending habits and site visit trends.
- **Customization**: Consumer data used for marketing purposes, either for general marketing or based on specific spending habits.
- **Advertisement**: Marketing communications including general promotions and feedback requests.
- **Functionality**: To improve service functionality using cookies and device storage for authentication and maintaining session data like carts.
- **Tracking**: Collecting data on site visits and interactions for security purposes and to understand consumer behavior.
- **Security**: Mentioned in the context of collecting information for security purposes and PCI compliance for card transactions.

**Additional Notes**

- **Consent for Data Processing**: This is implied by the consumer's actions (making a purchase and inputting their information).
- **Third-Party Involvement**: While direct sharing with third parties is not explicitly detailed beyond payment processing and email receipt management, the use of third-party tools like Sendgrid is mentioned.
- **Consumer Rights**: The policy does not explicitly detail consumer rights such as accessing, correcting, or deleting their data.

User: This taxonomy serves as your reference for understanding and classifying various privacy practices mentioned in the policies.
Privacy Behavior Taxonomy:
Category: Actions
 - sub: Subcategories: Consent, Delete, stop, anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Collect: Synonyms: Store, Keep, Retain, Provide Us, save; Subcategories: external, Internal, Third-Party, Automatic; 
 - Process: Synonyms: Use; Subcategories: Inference, Reference; 
 - Share: Synonyms: Transfer, Disclose, Disclosure, Use Third Party; Subcategories: Internal; 
Category: Data Types
 - sub: Subcategories: anonymize, aggregate; 
 - Personal Data: Synonyms: Personally Identifiable Information, PII, Personal Information, Your Data, Your Information; Subcategories: Contact Data, Health Data, Social Media, Location, Financial, Usage Data, Tracking, Account Information; 
Category: Purpose
 - Contact: Synonyms: Support, Messaged; Subcategories: Receive, Send, Communicate; 
 - Analytics: Synonyms: analyze; Subcategories: Data Analysis, User Similarity, Statistical Analysis, User Habits, Internal Analysis, Marketing Effectiveness, System Analysis; 
 - Customization: Synonyms: personalization; Subcategories: Customer Profile, Manage Account, Memorization; 
 - Advertisement: Synonyms: marketing, advertising; Subcategories: Tailored Ads, Targeted Ads; 
 - Security: Subcategories: System Protection, User Protection; 
 - Tracking: Subcategories: Site Visits Internal, Site Visits External; 
 - Functionality: Synonyms: Provide, Optimize, Enable, Operate, Maintain, Better Service; Subcategories: Business Purpose, Commercial Purpose, Access, Accounts, Payments, Provide Service, Data Storage, Account Management, Provide Support, Order Fulfillment, Support, Promotions; 
 - Requirements: Synonyms: Compliance; Subcategories: legal compliance, Policy Compliance, Third-Party Compliance, Business Compliance; 
 - Save: Subcategories: Store, Order Progress; 
 - Identification: Synonyms: Identify, authenticate; Subcategories: Verified Feedback;
